description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

At the core of Google Assistant’s mission is the aim of successfully establishing a platform (Actions on Google) for third-party and first-party app developers to build high-quality experiences for the Google Assistant.

You are self-motivated, a creative technical problem solver who likes creating order out of chaos. You can also navigate ambiguity and have a passion for driving complex engineering projects to completion.

We build products in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and we expect that you can thrive in these environments, ask tough questions, keep things on track and be part of an awesome team.

There is always more information out there, and the Research and Machine Intelligence team has a never-ending quest to find it and make it accessible. We're constantly refining our signature search engine to provide better results, and developing offerings like Google Instant, Google Voice Search and Google Image Search to make it faster and more engaging. We're providing users around the world with great search results every day, but at Google, great just isn't good enough. We're just getting started.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of cross-functional Software Program Management experience working among multiple groups such as Engineering and Design teams.
  • Experience in shipping consumer-facing software products.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA or a Master's degree in a technical discipline.
  • Self motivated individual, with a positive attitude and the desire to make a positive impact through their contribution.
  • Effective organizational skills, with the ability to keep up with associated technical discussions. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to take ownership and to collaborate well with others. Ability to thrive when dealing with ambiguity and to bring order to chaos.
responsibilities:
• Facilitate and manage technical projects and drive them to launch. Oversee team discussions, drive issues to resolution, and help to identify and mitigate risks.
  • Work closely with Engineering, Product Management, UX, Business Development and other cross-functional partners in order to define requirements, and to oversee related scheduling, resourcing and milestones/tasks.
  • Manage releases with fixed deadlines and oversee tasks across lots of moving parts. Manage dependencies between internal and external teams.
  • Communicate project status to various audiences, including cross-functional and senior leadership teams.
title: Technical Program Manager, Actions on Google
